VIPSPage.PageTitle: ACM Transactions on Asian Language Information Processing

LayoutNode.Content: Editorial Charter
LayoutNode.SRC: Editorial Charter

LayoutNode.Content: The ACM Transactions on Asian Language Information Processing (TALIP) publishes high quality original archival papers and technical notes in the areas of computation and processing of information in Asian languages and related disciplines. The subject areas covered by TALIP include, but are not limited to:
LayoutNode.SRC: The ACM Transactions on Asian Language Information Processing (TALIP) publishes high quality original archival papers and technical notes in the areas of computation and processing of information in Asian languages and related disciplines. The subject areas covered by TALIP include, but are not limited to:

LayoutNode.Content: Computational Linguistics: including computational phonology, computational morphology, computational syntax (e.g. parsing), computational semantics, computational pragmatics, etc.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Computational Linguistics: including computational phonology, computational morphology, computational syntax (e.g. parsing), computational semantics, computational pragmatics, etc.

LayoutNode.Content: Linguistic Resources: including computational lexicography, terminology, electronic dictionaries, cross-lingual dictionaries, electronic thesauri, etc.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Linguistic Resources: including computational lexicography, terminology, electronic dictionaries, cross-lingual dictionaries, electronic thesauri, etc.

LayoutNode.Content: Hardware and software algorithms and tools for Asian language processing, e.g., handwritten character recognition.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Hardware and software algorithms and tools for Asian language processing, e.g., handwritten character recognition.

LayoutNode.Content: Information Understanding: including text understanding, speech understanding, character recognition, discourse processing, dialogue systems, etc.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Information Understanding: including text understanding, speech understanding, character recognition, discourse processing, dialogue systems, etc.

LayoutNode.Content: Machine Translation involving Asian languages.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Machine Translation involving Asian languages.

LayoutNode.Content: Information Retrieval: including natural language processing (NLP) for concept-based indexing, natural language query interfaces, semantic relevance judgments, etc.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Information Retrieval: including natural language processing (NLP) for concept-based indexing, natural language query interfaces, semantic relevance judgments, etc.

LayoutNode.Content: Information Extraction and Filtering: including automatic abstraction, user profiling, etc.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Information Extraction and Filtering: including automatic abstraction, user profiling, etc.

LayoutNode.Content: Speech processing: including text-to-speech synthesis and automatic speech recognition.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Speech processing: including text-to-speech synthesis and automatic speech recognition.

LayoutNode.Content: Multimedia Asian Information Processing: including speech, image, video, image/text translation, etc.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Multimedia Asian Information Processing: including speech, image, video, image/text translation, etc.

LayoutNode.Content: Cross-lingual information processing between Asian and Western natural language pairs.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Cross-lingual information processing between Asian and Western natural language pairs.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers that deal in theory, systems design, evaluation and applications in the aforesaid subjects are appropriate for TALIP. Emphasis will be placed on the originality and the practical significance of the reported research.
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers that deal in theory, systems design, evaluation and applications in the aforesaid subjects are appropriate for TALIP. Emphasis will be placed on the originality and the practical significance of the reported research.

LayoutNode.Content: In addition, papers published in TALIP must relate to some aspect of Asian language or speech processing. Asian languages include languages in East Asia (e.g. Chinese, Japanese, Korean), South Asia (Hindi, Tamil, etc), Southeast Asia (Malay, Thai, Vietnamese, etc), the Middle East (Arabic, etc), and so on.
LayoutNode.SRC: In addition, papers published in TALIP must relate to some aspect of Asian language or speech processing. Asian languages include languages in East Asia (e.g. Chinese, Japanese, Korean), South Asia (Hindi, Tamil, etc), Southeast Asia (Malay, Thai, Vietnamese, etc), the Middle East (Arabic, etc), and so on.

LayoutNode.Content: TALIP is also open to articles that provide literature and/or technology reviews in one of the above-mentioned areas. However, in order to be considered for publication, such an article must demonstrate that it provides information that is substantially different from what is available in the literature. The author(s) of review articles must submit a cover letter that clearly states why they believe their contribution adds useful material not covered elsewhere. Also, a review article should not just be a summarization of previous work: it must also be a work of exegesis. That is, the author(s) must show how the different strands of work relate to each other. They should also offer a view of where the field under review is going. A survey or review article submitted to TALIP will go through the usual review process only if the editors feel the submission adheres to the above guidelines.
LayoutNode.SRC: TALIP is also open to articles that provide literature and/or technology reviews in one of the above-mentioned areas. However, in order to be considered for publication, such an article must demonstrate that it provides information that is substantially different from what is available in the literature. The author(s) of review articles must submit a cover letter that clearly states why they believe their contribution adds useful material not covered elsewhere. Also, a review article should not just be a summarization of previous work: it must also be a work of exegesis. That is, the author(s) must show how the different strands of work relate to each other. They should also offer a view of where the field under review is going. A survey or review article submitted to TALIP will go through the usual review process only if the editors feel the submission adheres to the above guidelines.

LayoutNode.Content: Finally, starting with issue 12(4) (2013), a new editorial column entitled TALIP Perspectives has been launched. See here for an example. The editorial column is open anyone who wants to contribute an editorial on topics relevant to Asian language and speech processing. Contributors should contact the editor directly. Submissions will be shared with the Associate Editors for discussion. In rare instances, if the submission involves substantial technical content, we will ask an outside reviewer for assistance.
LayoutNode.SRC: Finally, starting with issue 12(4) (2013), a new editorial column entitled TALIP Perspectives has been launched. See here for an example. The editorial column is open anyone who wants to contribute an editorial on topics relevant to Asian language and speech processing. Contributors should contact the editor directly. Submissions will be shared with the Associate Editors for discussion. In rare instances, if the submission involves substantial technical content, we will ask an outside reviewer for assistance.
